revised_title: John Tradescant: A Prominent Figure in the Early Cultivation of Botany and Natural History
tldr: The author discusses the early cultivation of botany in England, focusing on John Tradescant's significant contributions to the field. Tradescant, a prominent figure in the 17th century, was a great promoter of botany and natural history, and served as a gardener to King Charles I. The article highlights his collection of rare plants, trees, and other natural specimens, as well as his influence on the development of botany in England.
